question: What is the position of Indian Railways Network in the world?
explanation: Indian Railways (IR) is India's national railway system operated by the Ministry of Railways. It manages the fourth largest railway network in the world by size,comprising 1,21,407 km of track length over a route of 67,368 km (41,834 mi). Indian Railway is Worldâ€™s fourth largest railway US, Russia and China. It carried some 23 million passengers everyday and around 1060 million tonnes of freight in a year.
